summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 12383, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Ross Place, and West Fortieth Street, each from Third Avenue Northwest to the north line of the Government Canal; West Forty-first Street and West Forty-second Street, each from Third Avenue Northwest to Sixth Avenue Northwest; West Forty-third Street, from Third Avenue Northwest to Eighth Avenue Northwest; West Forty-fourth Street, from Third Avenue Northwest to the east line of the Lottie Tract, and from Fifth Avenue Northwest to Eighth Avenue Northwest; West Forty-fifth Street, from Third Avenue Northwest to Eighth Avenue Northwest; Third Avenue Northwest, from Ross Place to West Forty-fifth Street, and Fifth Avenue Northwest, from West Forty-fourth Street, as platted in Lottie Tract, to West Forty-fourth Street, as platted in H. E. Allen's First Addition to the City of Seattle, by grading the same, in accordance with Resolution of the City Council of the City of Seattle, No. 447, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
